page.title: 08Stansted Saw Mill
page.content: This is a small operation...They buy in timber"in the round"i.e. as trees, from Stansted Estate (now very little due to conservation policies) or other timber mechants in Hampshire or Sussex __ thereby keeping purchase as local as posible.The trees are then converted into fencing, garden products, fencing panels, firewood etc.The waste product_sawdust_is used in kennels and stables on local farms.Their products are sold as far afield as London. Woods mainly dealt with are Oak (hardwood).Conifers such as Douglas fir,larch and Scots Pine (Softwood).
